subject: Re: [junit] All Methods Public
msgSnippet: ... Are they? You must define dead differently than I do. ... A wrench can be useful as a hammer, but that doesn t make a wrench a good hammer. -- J. B.
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> On 2/19/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...
> <mailto:jbrains762%40gmail.com>> wrote:
> >
> > "Helper" is a lullaby word in OO design, like "Manager" and "Worker".
> > There's a reason why Smalltalk environments consider utility methods to
> > be a code smell.
>
> There's a reason why Smalltalk environments are dead.

Are they? You must define "dead" differently than I do.

> It seems to me that helper methods/classes can be useful. I can
> certainly see why certain ways to implement them can be considered
> "smells", but it certainly doesn't make the overall concept useless.

A wrench can be useful as a hammer, but that doesn't make a wrench a
good hammer.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
